data.title: Downtown Medford
data.text: Good bar selections and can get Guinness on tap, some appetizers that are good, meals typical burgers, sandwiches...they do have a corned beef dinner plate.  Two levels, some armchair seating---the dark wood pub look for décor.

data.title: Friendly atmosphere
data.text: We had dinner here with another couple.  Service was quick and the food tasty.   Beer selection was super good -  a nice selection of IPAs on tap.  The place is very comfortable and enjoyable.

data.title: Great food, service and pride of ownership!
data.text: What a wonderful place for a girls lunch date! We had a wonderful server, who recommended great wines to pair with our lunch. It is definitely not bar food. We both had great food and the owner came by to make sure that, everything was perfect. It is in a convenient spot downtown, don't count it out for lunch.

data.title: Great atmosphere!
data.text: We enjoyed our dinner at 4 Daughters! I ordered half a chicken salad and it was a perfect portion, chicken was a bit dry but it didn't keep me from eating it! The staff was friendly and they had great accommodations. The drinks were good. The only reason I gave a very good rating was because we didn't all get our food at the same time, I'd say there was nearly a 10 minute gap between the first plates served and the last ones. We did have a big party (12), but the wait time getting all of our meals was a little long. I'll still eat there again though!

data.title: Top o the night to you
data.text:
It was two nights before Halloween. .. so it decorated and all employees were dressed up .........nice :)

I sat at bar and was immediately offered a menu and if I wanted a beverage

Had a Southwick s beer which was dark but not heavy....thumbs up

Clam chowder was thick and loaded...very good

Irish nachos were ok. .... no food is enhanced with nacho cheese sauce and this was no exception. .... melted cheddar would have made this dish awsome. ..

I would come back if in Medford again

data.title: It never rains in a pub
data.text:
A group of us from college were up in Medford visiting a friend and decided to give this place a try.  Boy were we pleasantly surprised.  The food was terrific and Audra, our server, was a gem.

Between us we had Guinness meatloaf, chicken pot pie, corn beef and cabbage and irish stew.  They were all very good.

For dessert you have to try the apple fries.  It's an apple that is sliced, dipped in something like tempera batter, fried and served with vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce.  Outstanding!  One of our group owns a restaurant and he's stealing for his establishment.

data.title: Just What I Hoped For
data.text: Four Daughters had good pub food and a great atmosphere. Exactly what I was hoping for. The server was friendly, and the food came out promptly.

data.title: Birthday dinner
data.text: Who set up reservations in advance and they had our table ready. Great food and a great environment and good traditional Irish Fair. The best fried pickles in southern Oregon bar none and I've tried them all. I highly doubt you would be disappointed coming here for food or drinks.

data.title: Great place for lunch
data.text: Definitely pub atmosphere in a good way. We shared the corned beef sandwich and garlic fries. More than ample for two of us. Good beer choices too.

data.title: Good Food and Service
data.text:
We arrived early, so it wasn't so crowded or noisy, but by the time we left it was.  

My husband really liked the corn beef and cabbage.  The corn beef was very tender with lots of flavor.  And the potatoes were delicious too.

I had a large salad that was very good. 

Our server was very good, even though he became super busy.  

We would visit again if in the Medford area.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Just in Medford for one night and had dinner here - excellent ! Loved the ambiance and the food was great, two courses and drinks for under $50 and how nice to find real vegetables in a land of fries !! Although they are on the menu of course !!

data.title: Nice place in Medford
data.text: We follow the recommandations of other travellers and go to this pub not ont once but twice while we stay in Medford. The place is very nice and quiet. The food is good, fresh ans not expensive. We have a good time there!

data.title: Great Atmosphere,  Good Food
data.text: As mentioned in other reviews,  this place has authentic pub atmosphere,  which adds to the enjoyment of the meal. I sat outside since it was a beautiful evening.  Traditional Irish pub food along with a long list of burgers fills the menu.  I had the Shepherd's Pie which was rich and delicious.  It was served with a green salad. Service was friendly and quick.  I recommend stopping in.

data.title: One of my favorite in Medford.
data.text: For a sports game, a debate, or just a group dinner, this place offers freindly service and a nice menue with some specialties from Ireland.

data.title: Have a seat. There are many choices.
data.text: This restaurant is a place in downtown Medford. Two story building. Food is excellent  there is quiet places to find even if crowded. Try it out for yourself✝

data.title: Really good Irish pub!
data.text: We found Four Daughters on TripAdvisor - - our most reliable site for restaurants in new places. The restaurant has a distinct Irish pub look and feel. The interior is very well decorated and attractive in a dark, intimate pub way. The menu is very pub-like with all the things you would expect, including Shepherd's Pie, Fish & Chips, Irish Stew, and lot's more. Good beer selection led by Guinness, of course. We had the killer Reuben Sandwich and Caesar Salads with shrimp. Both were tasty, well presented, and delivered quickly by very cheerful and attentive servers - the bartender is worth a visit all by himself. This was a good dinner in a very comfortable, welcoming restaurant operated by folks who obviously care about their business and customers.

data.title: Another great find.
data.text:
Passing through Medford and was recommended by hotel.  Looked up on trip advisor and it was everything We hoped for. The fish and chips combo (add shrimp) was outstanding. Beware when they say garlic fries they mean GARLIC fries lol.  The Blarney Burger was perfect.  Done just right, flavorful and with mushrooms and bacon - what more could you want. 

The service was quick and friendly.  

The atmosphere was great. It all came together to make for a delightful evening.

data.title: Good food, good drinks, good times with friends
data.text:
Everything about this restaurant and bar is outstanding.  It's a great place to stop for a drinks with friends and co-workers .  Seating includes table/chairs or couches around cocktail tables. Decore is very nice and comfortable. Nice Irish feel to this place. Food and service was outstanding.  I had the Irish stew which was very good.  The portions are large so bring a good appetite. 

This is a very poplar spot but don't worry there's a main and second floor to this establishment.  Great place for both business or casual dinning and drinks. A must stop when visiting Medford.

data.title: Fantastic Find
data.text: We stayed in Medford for two nights and wanted somewhere not too expensive, but with good food.  This place ticks both boxes.  Its a little quiet, but that was good for us as you can hold decent conversation without shouting.  We had the ribs which were succulent & plentiful with sweet potato fries.  Also had the salad wraps, which were really filling.  Our server, Piper, was pleasant and attentive and she made us feel welcome both nights we ate there.   Good beer selection & Great food is what you get

data.title: Our go to restaurant in Medford
data.text: Great selection of draft micro brews served ice cold. The interior is a picture perfect Irish pub. Great food. Don't miss the fish and chips or the paddy melt with garlic fries. Yum yum
